folder: Maryland Avenue & Fox Hill Terrace, Staten Island, NY
text:
(1)
Rosebank, Staten Island: A panoramic view across the village, toward the Upper Bay, seen from Maryland Avenue and Fox Hill Terrace. On the right can be seen the steeple of St. Marys R.C. Church, on Bay Street; in the center is a group of warehouses; on the left is the stack of the G. Siegle Color Works, on Chestnut Avenue.

P. L. Sperr

January 18, 1931

(2)
Another view across Rosebank, in the same general direction as seen from Maryland and Vermont Avenues. In the center of the view is Public School No. 13, on Hyland Boulevard and Anderson Street; preceding the school is the Hylan Boulevard bridge over the Staten Island tracks; to the right of the church spire are two stacks of the Wrigley chewing gum plant, and running from left to right, in the foreground, is Maryland Avenue; running perpendicular to the latter and the Boulevard is Vermont Avenue.

P. L. Sperr

February 2, 1931
title: Richmond: Maryland Avenue - Fox Hill Terrace
